ETYMOLOGY: From Latin radius ('spoke of a wheel, ray'). Adopted into English in the 16th century, primarily for the geometric concept.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word used to identify people, places, or things
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A straight line extending from the center of a circle or sphere to the circumference or surface; also, the length of this line.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 连接圆心或球心到圆周或表面的直线；亦指该直线的长度，即半径。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: To calculate the area, you must first know the radius of the circle.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 要计算面积，你首先必须知道圆的半径。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word used to identify people, places, or things
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A specified distance around a central point, defining a circular area or range.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 以某中心点为圆心，特定距离所界定的范围或区域。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The new restaurant delivers food within a two-mile radius.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这家新餐厅在两英里半径范围内提供送餐服务。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word used to identify people, places, or things
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The smaller of the two bones in the human forearm, located on the side of the thumb.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 人体前臂两块骨头中较小的一块，位于拇指一侧的桡骨。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: A fall often results in a fracture of the distal radius.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 摔倒经常导致桡骨远端骨折。
